title: Assignment 1: HTML & CSS Markup
description: Create the basic static layout for the Kanbas application using HTML structure and basic CSS styling. Focus on clean semantic markup and adherence to wireframes.

title: Assignment 2: JavaScript DOM Manipulation
description: Implement interactive elements using vanilla JavaScript. Manipulate the Document Object Model (DOM) to handle events, update content, and manage dynamic user interface components.

title: Homework 1: Data Preprocessing Report
description: Write a detailed report on the steps taken to clean and transform the provided raw dataset. Include sections on data cleaning, transformation, and feature selection.

title: Project Proposal: Association Rule Mining
description: Submit a proposal for the final data mining project, focusing on using association rule mining techniques (e.g., Apriori or FP-growth) on a public dataset.

title: Problem Set 1: Asymptotic Notation
description: Solve theoretical problems involving Big-O, Big-Omega, and Big-Theta notation. Provide formal proofs for each solution.

title: Problem Set 2: Sorting Algorithms Analysis
description: Analyze the time and space complexity of Quicksort, Mergesort, and Heapsort. Compare their performance under different input scenarios.

title: Lab 1: Shell Programming and Processes
description: Implement several scripts using Bash for file manipulation and process management. Demonstrate the creation of new processes.

title: Lab 2: Process Synchronization
description: Modify a multi-threaded program to prevent race conditions using semaphores or mutex locks. Document the synchronization mechanism used.

title: Vulnerability Analysis Report
description: Select a recent major software vulnerability (e.g., in a web browser or operating system), describe its attack vector, and analyze mitigation strategies.

title: Secure Coding Practice
description: Rewrite a small, insecure C++ program, applying principles of secure coding to prevent common issues like buffer overflows and injection flaws.

title: Network Protocol Simulation
description: Use a network simulator (e.g., NS-3 or Cisco Packet Tracer) to model and analyze the performance of a routing protocol (e.g., OSPF).

title: Network Security Analysis
description: Analyze common threats in Wi-Fi networks and propose a comprehensive security configuration for an enterprise setting.

title: SQL Queries and Normalization
description: Execute complex SQL queries using JOINs, aggregations, and subqueries. Additionally, normalize a given schema up to 3NF.

title: Database Design Project
description: Design and implement a transactional database system for a small business. Include the E-R diagram, relational schema, and a set of stored procedures.

title: Propulsion Theory Quiz
description: A short quiz covering the basic principles of chemical and electric propulsion systems.

title: Nozzle Design Calculations
description: Perform detailed calculations to design a DeLaval nozzle for optimal thrust at a given chamber pressure and altitude.

title: Airfoil Analysis Report
description: Analyze the lift and drag coefficients of two different NACA airfoils under subsonic flow conditions.

title: Fluid Dynamics Problem Set
description: Solve a set of problems focusing on Bernoulli's principle, continuity equation, and compressible flow.

title: Spacecraft Power Budget
description: Develop a detailed power budget for a small satellite mission, accounting for solar arrays, batteries, and orbital cycles.

title: Structural Stress Analysis
description: Perform finite element analysis (FEA) on a critical spacecraft structural component under expected launch loads.

title: Nomenclature and Isomers Quiz
description: Identify and correctly name organic compounds and draw all possible structural isomers for a given formula.

title: Synthesis Reaction Lab Report
description: Document the procedure, results, and analysis of a multi-step organic synthesis reaction performed in the lab.

title: Coordination Compounds Problem Set
description: Determine the geometry, hybridization, and magnetic properties of various coordination complexes.

title: Crystal Field Theory Homework
description: Calculate crystal field splitting energies ($Delta_o$) and predict the color of transition metal complexes.

title: Thermodynamics Problem Set
description: Solve problems involving the first and second laws of thermodynamics, focusing on enthalpy, entropy, and Gibbs free energy.

title: Kinetics Lab Write-up
description: Analyze experimental data to determine the reaction order and rate constant for a given chemical reaction.

title: Elvish Translation Exercise
description: Translate a short passage from Westron (Common Speech) into Quenya Elvish, focusing on correct syntax and verb conjugation.

title: Runes and Scripts Transcription
description: Transcribe several sentences from the Tengwar script into the Roman alphabet, demonstrating proficiency in both Sindarin and Quenya modes.

title: Case Study: The Last Alliance
description: Write a critical case study analyzing the strategic and diplomatic reasons for the formation and eventual dissolution of the Last Alliance of Elves and Men.

title: Diplomatic Strategy Paper
description: Propose a diplomatic plan for unifying the kingdoms of Gondor and Rohan in the post-War of the Ring era, detailing potential challenges and solutions.
